alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 1:52PM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Potential total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with 5 to 10 inches in Hot Springs and southern Washakie counties. North wind frequently gusting 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Cody Foothills, North Big Horn Basin, Southwest Big Horn Basin and Southeast Big Horn Basin. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible as the snow and wind combine to create reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Possible snow accumulation of 6 to 9 inches southwest of Cody and around Meeteetse.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. This storm has the potential to create widespread travel impacts.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
